ARTICLE.TITLE: Should You Wear a Watch if There’s No One to Impress?
ARTICLE.TEXT:
YES

If you legitimately care about watches, sure. Strapping on a Patek Philippe for Zoom calls just to have friends and co-workers salivate over your bezel is gauche, but the timepiece habits of dedicated collectors have scarcely changed in the Covid era. When he was working from home, Josh Jacobs, 33, who operates a clothing showroom in New York City, wore a wristwatch every day, if only to foster a sense of normalcy during a brutally abnormal year. “It’s just to keep that routine going,” he said.

Watch devotees say they’d...

METADATA.article.headline: Should You Wear a Watch if There’s No One to Impress?
METADATA.article.summary: Fans insist a timepiece is still helpful while you’re working from home. Other men consider sporting tickers in solitude a waste of time. We argue both sides.
METADATA.author: Todd Plummer and Jacob Gallagher
